page.title: 11THE NAVAN FORT
page.content: {The Navan Fort,}an Iron-Age fort three miles from Armagh,is the centre of the oldest Irish folk saga.Archaeological excavations during the 70's revealed many of its uses. A neighbouring {limestone quarry}had encroached on the environs of the Fort and applied for permissions to extend. An outcry by archaelogists historians and concerned local people forced the{Dept. of the {Environment}to hold a{public enquiry to make planning recommendations. The community is divided between those who wish to preserve intact a site which {has been used for over 2,000 years}and those who arque that an extension of the quarry will provide employment and yet do minimal damage to the site.The debate has attracted attention not merely in Ireland but also from {Britain and Europe.}A Govt.decision will follow the enquiry.
